sub_title: Occupational Health Nurse at United Nations Mechanism for International Criminal Tribunals (UN-MICT)
summary:
Michele is an Australian trained, United Kingdom registered nurse with fourteen years clinical nursing experience specialising in the fields of accident and emergency as well as adult and neonatal intensive care. This experience was gained in whilst working in Australia, United Kingdom and Saudi Arabia.

Since moving to the Netherlands, Michele has gained more than twenty-three years experience as an occupational health nurse in multicultural third sector organisations in The Hague.  She has been an integral team player in the successful establishment of medical units in two of those organisations.

Currently Michele is the Senior Occupational Health Nurse for the Medical Unit of the United Nations Mechanism for International Criminal Tribunals

Specialties: Occupational Health and Safety, Healthcare Management in an international environment, Lifestyle Management and Workplace Ergonomics.

Castle Hill High school, Sydney, Australia

profile_positions.title: Occupational Health Nurse

company.name: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia

profile_positions.company: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
profile_positions.description:
CLINICAL
Responsible for the day to day runing of the Medical Unit: Walk-in clinic, travel health advice, medical clearances, consultations, first aid and emergency.

Health promotion programs including work environment and occupational health issues; workstation ergonomic training and lifestyle management.

Perform: ECG, urine, glucose and cholesterol tests, blood pressure monitoring, fitness testing.

MEDICO ADMINISTRATIVE 
Following United Nations established medical policies and procedures regarding medical clearances, emergencies, business continuity, crisis management and medical preparedness. Includes job related injuries/illnesses.

Management sick leave initiating and monitoring return to work programs. 

Achievements: Providing information promptly and concisely to staff and/or management that will minimise misunderstanding or unnecessary loss of man-hours to the organisation but upholding integrity, confidentiality and the well-being of the staff both at the Hague and in regional offices.
profile_positions.title: Occupational Health Nurse

company.name: International Criminal Court - Cour Pénale Internationale

profile_positions.description: Instrumental in all aspects in the establishment of an occupational medical service to the International Criminal Court, the Hague.
profile_positions.title: Occupational Health Nurse, Unit Manager

company.name: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
Primary team player in the establishment of the medical clinic within the Health and Safety Branch of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons.

Achievements: Working together with a dynamic team to create a fully functional medical service; paticipating in the writing and implementation of SOP's and WI's for the branch and the organisation as a whole. Ensuring chemical inspectors travelled and worked medically fit and well prepared.
profile_positions.title: Occupational Health Nurse

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
Principle team member in the establishment of the Health and Safety Branch of the Preparatory Commission to the OPCW.

Personal Achievements: successful transition from clinical nursing to a third sector organisation environment. Effectively establishing the foundations of a medical facility for the new international organisation. Achieving extensive administrative skills and understanding of the international organisational environment its culture and language.
